reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 9 yr old Grandson on His Christmas List!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My Boys Loved It
reviews.reviewText: My four year old and six year old read these books together. They really loved them! They laughed several times and enjoyed the overall story. It only took them a short time to read them, which was the only negative, but I'm still glad we got them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars If You Like Laughing, Read This Book!
reviews.reviewText: I am voluntarily reviewing an advanced reader copy of this book, The Fantastic Flatulent Fart Brothers Go To The Moon! by M. D. Whalen.I got this book for my 9 year old son as he thinks farting is hilarious. He and his best friend are constantly telling each other fart and poop jokes.I had a feeling he would like it and boy did he, in fact, he LOVED it! Plus his best for was here when I read it and he LOVED it too! I even found it to be very funny and I'm constantly telling my son his "potty humor" not really funny.Honestly, I would recommend this book for any age, child and adult. If you have a sense of humor, then this book is for you!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Who knew a fart would be valuable on Uranus?!
reviews.reviewText: I was given an ARC for my honest opinion, or the opinion of a boy 9-12 which is what this story is meant for. Well, I am a 47 year old woman and loved it! Peter and Willy are typical boys and brothers. Each trying to outdo the other, and each wanting to place blame for everything that goes wrong on their little sister. Their combined farting capabilities reach to the moon and back. The unsung hero of the book is a hamster named Squeaky! I wish I would have had this book when my son was younger. He may have actually found a book that he would have read! The fart facts at the end are genius!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Kids liked it
reviews.reviewText: Kids liked it and anything you can get them to read is a plus especially at a young age

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The art of flatulence doesn't get much funnier than this
reviews.reviewText: Willy and Peter are brothers especially gifted at the art of flatulence. While at home, this normally gets them in trouble. But while encountering aliens from Uranus, their gift is an incredible asset. Maybe too much of an asset. Will they escape?I loved the second book in the Fantastic Flatulent Fart Brothers series! You don't have to read them in order, and I think this one is even better than the first. What could be better than farts in space? Annoying little sisters? And possibly my favorite characters, The Big Fat Pupu Face, Pipi Face and Pipi Pants. (And here I am laughing again!) I cannot recommend this book enough for kids drawn to potty humor with cartoon illustrations like Captain Underpants, Icky & Ricky, or Fart Squad: Fartasaurus Rex.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So Good....So Gross
reviews.reviewText: I received an advanced reader copy in exchange for a fair and honest review. This book is utterly disgusting!! My kids LOVED it...it was right up their alley. The author achieved his goal.This book was so much fun to read out loud to my kids. As you read it you can visualize the story. Crazy. This was my first book from this author but it won't be my last. Thanks for a great kids read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An over the moon and smelly read
reviews.reviewText: You gotta love potty humor. I'm the mother of two sons and two grandsons, plus a husband. They are all into potty humor. If this gets them into reading, I'm all for it. I especially loved the illustrations....funny!I voluntarily reviewed an advance reader copy of this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 22, 2020
reviews.reviewText: Hilarious. Enjoyed reading with my eight year old x
